articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: On Trump trial, Sen. McConnell gets fact-check by sis of his Senate colleagues at once
articles.description: As the Senate marches towards putting Pres. Trump on trial, six former senators who served as jurors in the Senate trial of Pres. Clinton weigh in on the process in this rare joint interview with MSNBC Chief Legal Correspondent Ari Melber.  The senators fact-…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: NBC News reporter Tom Costello: What was that Ukrainian...
articles.description: "Every single aviation source I talked to … said ‘There was no indication this was mechanical. This appears to have been a catastrophic, external event,'" Tom Costello says.

articles.title: Yasiin Bey (Mos Def) on his favorite musicians, Chappelle & new art | Full Interview
articles.description: Artist Yasiin Bey (Mos Def) talks to MSNBC anchor Ari Melber in this extended interview from inside Bey's new installation at the Brooklyn Museum, where Bey explains his approach to making music and art today, why Dave Chappelle is one of “his dearest friends…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Chuck Todd is obsessed with #BigIfTrue
articles.description: Three little words cover a whole heck of a lot, Chuck Todd says.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Gabbard: This was an 'assassination'
articles.description: Presidential Candidate Tulsi Gabbard says the administration has NOT justified the killing of Qassem Soleimani. She joins Katy Tur to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Eric Swalwell talks war powers resolution
articles.description: California Democratic Congressman Eric Swalwell joins Katy Tur to discuss the war powers resolution

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Escalating Iran tensions spill into the 2020 race
articles.description: The Iowa caucuses are just 25 days away, but the ongoing crisis between the U.S. and Iran may have changed the entire state of the race. Democratic Strategist Basil Smikle and Canary CEO Dan Eberhart join Stephanie Ruhle to discuss the effects of Iran on 2020.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: FT: Only 37% say they're better off since Trump took office
articles.description: A majority of Americans are saying President Trump's policies have helped the economy, but the poll isn't exactly a win for the president. Financial Times U.S. Editor Peter Spiegel joins Stephanie Ruhle to break it down.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Lieu on War Powers Resolution: 'This is going to be a bipartisan vote'
articles.description: Congressman Ted Lieu of California speaks with Nicolle Wallace about the House vote on the War Powers Resolution and what’s next for the impeachment trial

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: House conducting vote to limit Donald Trump’s powers as Commander-in-chief
articles.description: House votes on a resolution that would force the president to seek congressional authorization before taking further military action against Iran

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Poll: Warren drops 12 points in New Hampshire
articles.description: "The fact that Bernie is not surging, though, says a lot about his next-door-neighbor state," Chuck Todd says.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Udall on Pelosi's decision to hold articles of impeachment: ‘I...
articles.description: Sen. Tom Udall (D-N.M.) supports Speaker Pelosi’s decision to keep holding articles of impeachment saying, “I think we’ve gained something by her actions, and I support what she’s done.”

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Thursday's Mini-Report, 1.9.20
articles.content:
Today’s edition of quick hits:
* Flight PS752: U.S. intelligence officials have evidence that suggests the Ukraine International Airlines jetliner that crashed in Iran on Wednesday, killing 176 people, was downed by an Iranian missile by mistake, multiple of… [+1797 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Pelosi holds off sending impeachment articles, exercising leverage over McConnell
articles.description: "The reality is: The longer she holds these articles, the longer she drags this process out," NBC News' Kasie Hunt says.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Officials: Evidence suggests Iranian missiles mistakenly shot down Ukrainian plane
articles.description: NBC News has learned from multiple officials that U.S. intelligence has evidence suggesting the Ukraine International Airlines plane that crashed Wednesday with 176 people on board was mistakenly shot down by an Iranian missile.  MSNBC’s Ali Velshi talks with…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Kaine on war powers: “it’s time we take it back” from POTUS
articles.description: Congress is set to vote on a resolution aimed to curb President Trump’s ability to wage war with Iran. Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.) joins Ali Velshi to discuss the war powers resolution he drafted for the Senate, and the legality of the White House decision to take…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What the President hears when deciding on military action
articles.description: Ali Velshi talks with Retired Brig. Gen. Mark Kimmitt, a former Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for the Middle East, about what Presidents hear from their advisers when it comes to deciding whether to proceed with military action.
